intro: Corunastylis anthracina, commonly known as the black-flowered starwort, is a member of the Commelinaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive star-shaped inflorescence. The flowers are typically dark purple to black, with prominent white veins, giving it a striking appearance. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, linear leaves and produces seeds in capsule-like structures.
